Topic.Title: Obama: 'I'm not done yet'

Message.Msg: And Vice President Sarah "Snow Princess" Palin worked out so well that you felt confident enough to run with Mitt Romney? Interesting that you recognize the existence of "legacy costs" (the obligation to live up to contractual responsibility on the part of the General Motors corporate entities) in the case of the workers who kept GM from mismanaging itself into bankruptcy long ago but ignore the impact of legacy obligations to our allies and our service members. Why is it that you hate America so much that you'd sacrifice our honor at the altar of your greed and wilful ignorance? You seem to be very addled in your dotage, Mr. Wilkerson.

Topic.Title: Obama: 'I'm not done yet'

Message.Msg: Stockholders who don't realize the risk involved in their speculation into the value of a security are sometimes unpleasantly surprised. The fact that this is the way bankruptcy law works should be no shocking discovery to you since you've stiffed your employees and creditors in much the same way due to the failure of your "successful business" while your attention was entirely occupied with posting POLITICAL OPINIONS on this message board every day for at least the last ten years, most often in sixteen hour marathon sessions which devolve into greater and greater incoherence as they progress. Managerial employees of GM were bought out of their pension obligations by the election of a lump sum payment or a PRU managed annuity. Union workers negotiated a stake in the restructured company. F ain't doing that hot either. Its creditors take the risk that there's no return to the crazy that left F to be the fail leader in the industry (due to mismanagement, by the way, not due to the paltry compensation provided to its workers). Neither should concern you since your message board trolling career won't be impacted either by the success or failure of either enterprise. Shareholders are never ensured of any return on their investment and never should be. The business of an enterprise is not to make speculators or a hapless set of middle and upper "managers" wealthy but rather to keep the customer satisfied. Something you have always failed at, even in your message board posting career.

Topic.Title: Let me explain something to you 'tax the rich' lefties, a business primer

Message.Msg: Will this "explanation" reverse the trend in the responses to the "bestest" pollster's continuing shift toward the re-election of President Barack Hussein Obama, a shift that has extended accross several days now and eliminated five percentage points from the probability that former half-term failed Governor of the Commonwealth of Massachusetts (formerly a wholly owned subsidiary of Bain Capital, Inc. and affiliates) will be anything but an unemployed grifter? Are you certain as to the general inefficiency of our self-governance for any purpose other than "the military" (not known for its current high return on investment, by the way)? Perhaps more importantly, if the Federal government is such a problem for the Galtian types why was David Koch so interested in the Vice Presidency in 1980? Has he had a change of heart about his political ambitions or does he prefer to operate by proxy now?

Topic.Title: Let me explain something to you 'tax the rich' lefties, a business primer

Message.Msg: Conversion of ongoing earned income to "money at risk" (when there's no risk) while declaring falsely that the earnings were of zero value is exactly the "mechanism allows Romney to pay a 14% tax rate" when he wants to look good prior to a run for the Presidency (again). At other points in time he has arranged for a ZERO Federal income and capital gains tax rate; for instance during the years 1999 to 2009. Since your bankruptcy (largely due to your continuous wasting of your time and effort posting incoherent, irrelevant nonsense on message boards) has left you unencumbered by the concerns of making a weekly payroll (you misspelled weakly, by the way) it would appear that you are and remain the clueless fool here.

Topic.Title: Income tax rates in 1912 were 0% and the country has essentially no debt

Cuts in the Navy would not be so deep almost 200 ships in 1910 no carriers or submarines they are the big ticket items cut them and we would be close to 1910 levels.
